title: Newspaper font
content:
What font are usually used in newspepers?  
I need about 20 names.  
Like Times new Roman, Baskerville.  
Help.

 [‹ Anyone?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/typophile.com/node/52218 "Go to previous forum topic") [Typeface of the British Museum ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/typophile.com/node/52215 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Pablo135

comments.content: [Ascender’s study](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/www.ascendercorp.com/pr/pr2004_11_09.html) found that the 10 most popular typeface families are: [Poynter](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/fontbureau.com/fonts/PoynterOSText), [Franklin Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/itc/itc_franklin_gothic_std_complete_vp/), [Helvetica](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/linotype/neue_helvetica_std_complete_vp/), [Utopia](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/creative_alliance/utopia_std_complete_vp/), [Times](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/linotype/times_std_complete_vp/), [Nimrod](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/nimrod_std_vp/), [Century Old Style](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/monotype_century_old_style_pro_vp/), [Interstate](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Interstate), [Bureau Grotesque](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Bureau%20Grot) and [Miller](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Miller). Further, 35 of the top 100 daily newspapers use a custom typeface or modified font in addition to retail, off-the-shelf fonts.

That was for American newspapers, by the way. My guesses at 10 more (European and American):

[Frutiger](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/linotype/frutiger_pro_complete_vp/)  
 [Minion](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/creative_alliance/minion_pro_complete_vp/)  
 [ITC Century](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/creative_alliance/itc_century_std_complete_vp/)  
 [Corona](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/linotype/corona_std_complete_vp/)  
 [Univers](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/linotype/univers_std_complete_vp/)  
 [Escrow](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/fontbureau.com/fonts/Escrow)  
 [Gotham](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Gotham)  
 [Whitney](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100026)  
 [FF Meta](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_meta_pro_collection/)  
 [FF DIN](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_din_pro_collection/)

<cite>… use a custom typeface or modified font in addition to retail, off-the-shelf fonts.</cite>

Some examples:  
 [The Guardian family](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/www.christianschwartz.com/guardian.shtml) by [Christian Schwartz](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Christian%252BSchwartz)  
 [Floris](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/www.lucasfonts.com/fonts/floris/) and [Taz](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/www.lucasfonts.com/fonts/taz/about/) by [Luc(as) de Groot](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Luc%252528as%252529%252Bde%252BGroot)  
Le Monde by [Porchez Typofonderie](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/www.typofonderie.com/)

Also, have a [look at the typefaces](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/www.gerardunger.com/) of [Gerard Unger](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Gerard%252BUnger): several of them have been made specifically for the use in newspapers, like Swift, Coranto or Gulliver.
Swift should have been on my second list.

The Dutch newspaper [nrc·next](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/www.nrcnext.nl/) uses the entire [Lexicon](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202022852/http:/www.teff.nl/fonts/lexicon/index.html) family — I quite like it.
